meanings.definition: Excessively modest or shy in behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: She was so overmodest that she rarely spoke up in class.
meanings.sent2: He was overmodest about his achievements, never wanting to boast.
meanings.sent3: It was quite overmodest of her to blush at receiving a compliment.
meanings.sent4: Her overmodest nature was like a delicate flower, easily overshadowed.
meanings.sent5: The overmodest girl always downplayed her talents, hiding her true potential.

meanings.definition: Showing excessive modesty or reserve in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: The overmodest student always downplayed his intelligence.
meanings.sent2: She was overmodest about her artwork, never wanting to draw attention to herself.
meanings.sent3: It was quite overmodest of him to refuse the praise for his hard work.
meanings.sent4: Her overmodest demeanor was like a veil, hiding her true thoughts and feelings.
meanings.sent5: The overmodest gentleman always deferred to others, never putting himself first.
